alert.note: Alert for Grant; Kay (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 02 at 2:27AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Grant and eastern Garfield Counties through 300 AM CDT... At 227 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 5 miles northwest of Hunter to 4 miles northwest of Douglas. Movement was northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Enid, Garber, Covington, Lamont, Breckenridge, Hunter, Fairmont, Deer Creek and Douglas. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
